about_the_game:
Street beatscapes. Corporate motivational. High-energy electronausea. Pseudo-tribal cyberfunk. The list goes on. This absolute juggernaut-beasthemoth of a soundtrack spans all possible moods, genres, emotions, and vibrations. One minute you're [NOT SMOKING] a [NOT CIGARETTE] outside the nightclub, another you're skidding through the muddy slopes of a construction site, a goblin freak shredding on a banjo on the sidelines. Any possible situation you find yourself in, either in-game or in-lyfe, can be enhanced with one of the 38 "bops", "choons", or "bangers" contained within this treasure trove of a soundtrack.

Featuring 20 tracks by extra-dimensional entity magicdweedoo, 17 tracks by local Melbourne avant-garde beatseer Stoneset, and an absolute "fire" party anthem by the one and only Tommy Tone, the Dryft City Kyngs Soundtrack is truly and objectively the greatest video game soundtrack ever produced.
